mcq.prompt:
Which of the following statements are /is true for the SIA Building Contract (Lump Sum):

i) The contract is a fixed price not subject to measurement or recalculation should the actual quantities of work and materials differ from estimates.
ii) It is c ompulsory that the Bill of Quantities shall form part of the contract documents
iii)Iterim Certificates issued by the Architect can be amended
iv)The Contractor is obligated to notify the Architect in writing within 14 days of any event or direction or instruction which he considers entitles him to an Extension of Time.
mcq.explanation:
i - Correct - Article 8 SIA 2016 BUILDING CONTRACT Without Quantities (Article 8)
ii - Wrong - BQ is only for measurement contract
iii - Correct - Cl 31(4) Correcting Earlier Certificates  - SIA 2016 BUILDING CONTRACT Without Quantities
iv - Wrong - should be 28 days instead of 14 days “Cl 23(3)(a) The contractor shall notify the Architect in writing within 28 days of any event of Diretion or Instruction which he shall consider as entitling him to an EOT. This notice shall be condition precedent to granting an extension of time.”

mcq.prompt: Under the SIA Building Contract, Liquidated Damages are usually computed between the time of:
mcq.optionA: Completion Certificate and Termination of Delay Certificate
mcq.optionB: Delay Certificate and Termination of Delay Certificate
mcq.explanation:
A -  Wrong, completion cert issue when the work done without affecting Employer's full enjoyment and occupation of the property Cl 22(5)(a)(ii) Outstanding works
B - Correct- Cl 24(2) LD & 24(3) Termination of delay cert
C - Wrong, maintenance cert issue end of DLP period
D - Wrong

mcq.prompt:
Which of the following is/are grounds for Extension of Time under the REDAS D&B Contract:
i) A variation instructed by the Employer's Representative
ii) Delay in obtaining authorities' approvals
iii) Suspension of Works under Section 23 and 26 of the SOP Act
i) Employer Termination of a Main Contractor's Qualified Person before TOP
mcq.explanation:
i -  Correct - Cl 16.1.1 Grounds for EOT
ii - Wrong - it is contractor responsibilities Cl 1.12.1 compliance with statues, regulations and laws
iii - Correct - Cl 31.1.1 suspension of works
iv - Cl 4.3.3 & 4.3.4 Qualified Design Professionals. The Contractor shall be fully liable for all acts, omissions and default of such qualified professionals/persons.

mcq.prompt: Under the SIA Minor Works Contract, when does the Contractor submit a Payment Claim to the Employer?
mcq.optionA: 14 days after the Architect's Interim Certificate has been issued
mcq.optionB: 35 days after the Architect's Interim Certificate has been issued
mcq.optionC: Where the interim payment is based on periodic valuation, on the last day of each month
mcq.optionD: When he disputes the amount certified by the Architevt in his Interim Certificate

mcq.prompt:
You are the Superintending Officer (SO) administering a PSSCOC Contract that has just r eceived Temporary Occupation Permit (TOP). You have just found out that one item was constructed without the issuance of a Superintending Officer Instruction (SOI). You should:

i)Issue SOI
ii) Inform Contractor of oversight
iii) Obtain official variation approval from Employer
iv) Backdate all SOIs issued and re-issue in sequence
mcq.explanation:
i -  Correct
ii - Correct - should inform (no clause mentioned to inform)
iii - Correct - any variation should get approval from client
iv - wrong - PSSCOC never mentioned can backdate / issue amendment like SIA

mcq.prompt:
The Employer has terminated the employment of Main Contractor under the SIA Building Contract. The Contractor shall:

i) Leave the site
ii) Submit Claim for Works completed to date
iii) Complete works that cannot be stopped midway due to safety issues
iv) Remove unused materials and equipment from site
mcq.explanation:
i -  Correct - CL 32(1)(c)
ii - Correct - SOP act (can claim for works completed before C receive Termination Cert)
iii - Wrong- 33(2)(a) - terminate with immediate effect. The contractor may use the same reason to continue the work
iv - Wrong - Cl 32(4)(c)

mcq.prompt: Under the SIA Building Contract, which of the following must occur before the issuance of the Delay Certificate?
mcq.optionA: After the issuance of Completion Certificate
mcq.optionB: After the receipt of Temporary Occupation Permit (TOP) from the Building Construction Authority (BCA)
mcq.optionC: After the issuance of Final Certificate
mcq.optionD: After the assessment of all EOT and no further EOT matters are outstanding

mcq.prompt:
Under the SIA Minor Works Contract, which of the following is / are true with regards to the Certificate of Liquidated Damages Entitlement (CLDE)?

i) Only one CLDE can be issued by the Architect after he/she has assessed all Extensions of Time.
ii) A CLDE states the number of days the Contractor is in default as well as the amount of liquidated damages the Employer is entitled to deduct.
iii) A CLDE is issued by the Employer when he wants to deduct liquidated damages.
iv) The Employer is obliged to deduct the amount certified by the Architect in the CLDE.
mcq.explanation:
i -  Wrong - Cl 16 (8)
ii - Correct - Cl 16 (9) (a)
iii - Wrong - Cl 16 (8) Employer inform architect in writing to issue CLDE
iv - Wrong - Cl 16 (9) (b)

mcq.prompt: Under the PSSCOC, which of the following is true?
mcq.optionA: The Employer takes the risk for adverse physical conditions for sub-surface works
mcq.optionB: The Contractor is not entitled to claim for loss and expense if the Employer fails to give possession of the Site on or before the date stated in the Letter of Acceptance.
mcq.optionC: The Contractor is entiteld to terminate his employment if the Employer interferes with the certification of the Superintending Officer.
mcq.optionD: The Superintending Officer must be an Architect registered with the Board of Architects
mcq.explanation:
A -  Cl 5.2
B - Wrong - Contractor is entitled to claim - Cl 12.3
C - Wrong
D - Wrong - can be anyone - Cl 1.1 (ab)

mcq.prompt:
Under the REDAS D&B Contract, where the Employer is appointing his own Architect to provide and act as qualified person (QP) for the architectural design, which of the following is/are true?

i) The Contractor is responsible for the sufficiency and correctness of the architectural design.
ii) The Contractor shall obtain all necessary approvals from the relecant authorities to enable the Employer's QP to obtain the Temporary Occupation Permit (TOP).
iii) The Employer's Representative cannot issue the Handing Over Certificate until TOP is obtained by the Employer's QP.
iv) If TOP is delayed by the Employer's QP, the Contractor is entitled to apply for extension of time.
mcq.explanation:
i - Correct Cl 4.1.1
ii -Correct Cl 4.2.1
iii - Correct Cl 11.2.1.2
iv - Correct, Cl 16.1.3
